conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions—I'm Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the opportunity to join your community. I’m ready to commit if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.

Since B is our top choice and is willing to commit, accepting now guarantees the best possible match for us; there is no upside to waiting because no student outranks B on our list. Accepting also prevents losing B to their higher-preferred schools (A or B) in later rounds.

I should avoid filling my only seat too early if there is a reasonable chance of attracting E/B/C. Student_E ranks School_B last, so unlikely to apply. Student_B ranks School_B second and may apply if not accepted by School_A; School_A prioritizes E then D then A then B, so B is not highly prioritized there and may be rejected, potentially coming to me in a later round. Student_C ranks School_B first and is likely to apply soon. Therefore, rejecting D now risks losing D, but accepting D now could block a better match with B or C. Given the mechanism (no waitlist/hold action) and objective to match as high as possible on my list, I should reject D now to preserve capacity for B or C who are likely to appear.
